channel.title: Transpose external sequences
channel.description: Hello, I have a Digitakt and I want to use Axoloti as a midi utility unit connected to MIDI-USB. The first utility is to transpose sequences of digitakt, ex. on track 8 I have a sequence written in midi. How can it be transposed? I tried midi / in / keyb> midi / out / note but it does not work.

item.title: Transpose external sequences
item.dc:creator: @altdelay altdelay
item.description:
@altdelay wrote:

No option worked. I do not know what the problem is but it does not transpose with either of the two options. I want a transposition like that of the mother 32 but I do not get it.

Read full topic

item.title: Transpose external sequences
item.dc:creator: @altdelay altdelay
item.description:
@altdelay wrote:

Thanks, I understand but my PC is now far from my axo, there are only a few hours left to test the transposition.
Axoloti is great with digitakt. I would like to implement more midi operations to alter the sequences written in digitakt and give more movement to the melodies, something like Markov would be fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Transpose external sequences
item.dc:creator: @ricard Ricard Wanderlof
item.description:
@ricard wrote:

@altdelay, @reubenfinger: the transpose object (and thru object too for that matter) has a device parameter which specifies which device it operates on. In the example in the other thread, it is set to din, so it takes data from the MIDI IN DIN jack, processes (transposes) it, and send the result to the MIDI OUT DIN jack.

The midi/in/keyb object is just there to provide the drive for the red led, it's not actually used to read MIDI data for transposing.

Read full topic

item.title: Transpose external sequences
item.dc:creator: @MattilynMattroe
item.description:
@MattilynMattroe wrote:

This worked fine for me for a simple transpose-

20190611_194724.jpg2015x1511 1.53 MB

Make sure you select the incoming midi channel from the top menu, outgoing channel/device is selected in the out object.

Read full topic

item.title: Transpose external sequences
item.dc:creator: @reubenfinger
item.description:
@reubenfinger wrote:

Just had a closer look at the patch and can see your confusion, there is no midi out, perhaps this is a transpose for internal midi, @ricard is there any chance you can shed some light on this for @altdelay, I am away from my axoloti at the moment.

I may have a proper look at it later

Read full topic

item.title: Transpose external sequences
item.dc:creator: @reubenfinger
item.description:
@reubenfinger wrote:

MIDI transpose patch example

Ok, here's an updated version, which has a configurable midi/thru object so that it echos other MIDI messages than note on and off. I've also added an omni attribute to the midi/transpose and midi/thru objects so that they either operate on any MIDI channel, or the specific one set for the patch. When I tried adding parameters I got an 'out of scope' error when referencing them in the MIDI code. What I seemed to need to do is have internal local variables to which I copy the parameter values iâ€¦

this post contains a midi transpose patch and two objects (all by ricard that you'll need to put in your library),controlled by program change, I don't have time to check it just now, but download the patch and the objects, drag and drop the objects into ricards community contributions folder and run the patch, should work fine

Read full topic
